info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 27 at 6:21PM EST until January 27 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFIELD...NORTH CENTRAL RICHLAND AND WESTERN KERSHAW COUNTIES... At 621 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Springdale to near Columbia International University, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Forest Acres, Dentsville, Arcadia Lakes, Fairfield County Airport, Villages at Sandhill, Columbia International University, Liberty Hill, Elgin, Killian, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina, Longtown, Lake Wateree State Park, Woodfield, Lugoff, Blythewood, Ridgeway, Pine Grove Fire Station, and Smallwood. This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 68 and 75. Interstate 77 between mile markers 17 and 39. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
